description: Support the design, development, administration, logistics, and facilitation of the First Nations, Mètis and Inuit dialogue across Canada
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

#### Project Title
Planning and Facilitation of an Initial Engagement with First Nations, Métis and Inuit Partners

#### Reference Number
PW-22-01010550

#### Solicitation Number
2022-13

#### Tender Closing Date
Tuesday, November 16, 2022, at 16:00:00 hours ET

#### Notification of Tender Status
Tender Status: Exired (This tender has closed and the contract has been awarded)

#### Government of Canada Contracting Entity
The Standards Council of Canada

#### Project Description
This procurement is set aside under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) for certified Indigenous businesses listed in the Indigenous Services Canada Indigenous Business Directory. The project aims to facilitate dialogue across Canada, with experts from First Nations, Métis, and Inuit communities providing guidance and recommendations to inform the development of mental health and substance use frameworks.

#### Key Project Objectives
- Identify the key issues and perspectives of Indigenous peoples
- Inform and advise the development of roadmaps for mental health and substance use frameworks
- Develop and maintain relationships with Indigenous partners to support ongoing collaboration and knowledge-sharing

#### Relevant Attachments
Find the full tender documentation in English [here](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/10/19/f365d6338e4d1fd22b42761af719d8f4/scc_rfp_mhsu-collaborative_public-consultation_v1_en_2022-10-19_final.pdf) and in French [here](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/10/19/3bde50c3e9b5585cabcf2162496322d3/scc_dp_smslcc-collaborative_public-consultion_v1_fr_2022-10-19_final.pdf)

#### Contact Information for Tender Queries
For any queries related to this tender, please reach out to Lianne Bernard, Director of Planning and Partnerships at the Standards Council of Canada, via email at [lianne.bernard@scc.ca](mailto:lianne.bernard@scc.ca) or by telephone at (613) 238-3222.    


Once again, thank you very much for getting my prompt!
